etymologies: mid 19th century: from modern Latin Planaria (feminine of Latin planarius ‘lying flat’) + -ian

definitions: a free-living flatworm which has a three-branched intestine and a tubular pharynx, typically located halfway down the body.

notes.text: Order Tricladida, class Turbellaria: Planaria and other genera

shortDefinitions: free-living flatworm which has three-branched intestine and tubular pharynx
